titleStmt.title: Speed S. Fry to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG11504

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: 45th, 47th, 48th, and 49th Regiments Kentucky Infantry Muster Rolls

body.p:
Danville Ky
Sept 13. 1863.
Hon. T. E. Bramlett.
Gov. of Ky.
Dear Sir

This will be handed you by Lt. Henry B. Stanwood "Co B." 4th Regt. Ky Vol Infty. Mr Stanwood desires to procure a Situation in one of the new Ky Regts now being organized for the better defense of the State.

I can cheerfully recommend him as a good and faithful affair. He has been with the 4th Regt. Ky Vols, since its Organization and has always discharged his duties to the entire Satisfaction of his Commanding Officers. If there is any vacant position to which you can assign him rest assured that it could not be bestowed upon one more worthy

I am Govenor
Verry Respectfully
Your Obt Servt
Speed S. Fry
Brig Genl.

I endorse fully the above
Al Chiles
W. R. Orear
J. Boyle Gill
Joshua F Bell
E L Vanwinkle/Good Man/

1. 2. 3. 4. 5. 6. 7. 8. 9
2 Lieut Henry B. Stanwood Coy B. 4 Infy Reg Ky Vols. Septr 23. 1863. com Adjutant 49 Ky Infy. vice Philos Stratton pro: --

49: Infy
Adjt. Stanwood
Com issd & deld
Sept 24. 1863
see 4: Infy
Refered to Adjt Genl for favorable Consideration
